intro: Syngonanthus heterotrichus, commonly known as the variable thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, violet to blue flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
